AceForge - macOS Edition
========================

How to Launch AceForge:
-----------------------
Simply double-click "AceForge.app"!

When you launch AceForge.app:
  • A Terminal window will open automatically showing server logs
  • Keep the Terminal window open while using AceForge  
  • Your browser will open automatically when the server is ready
  • To stop: Press Ctrl+C in Terminal or use the Exit button in the browser

Installation:
-------------
1. Drag "AceForge.app" to your Applications folder (or any location)
2. Double-click "AceForge.app" to launch
3. On first launch, macOS may ask for security permission:
   - Go to System Settings > Privacy & Security
   - Click "Open Anyway" if prompted
   - This is normal for apps downloaded from the internet

System Requirements:
-------------------
- macOS 12.0 (Monterey) or later
- Apple Silicon (M1/M2/M3) or Intel Mac with AMD GPU
- 16 GB RAM recommended (32 GB+ for training)
- SSD with 20+ GB free space
- Internet connection for first-time model downloads

First Run:
----------
- AceForge will download AI models (~7-16 GB) on first use
- This may take several minutes depending on your connection
- The Terminal window will show download progress
- Once complete, your browser will open to the AceForge interface

Features:
---------
- Logs are streamed to both Terminal and the browser console
- Use the Exit button in the browser to gracefully shutdown
- Closing the Terminal window will also stop the application

For more information, visit:
https://github.com/audiohacking/AceForge
